How about changing the log level to error?

I am a little bit worried that this change will bring unexpected behavior to some of the previous users.

I checked the Git commit log and this code has been committed since 2012.07.01. The first version used `e.printStackTrace()`, and then 2012.07.06 was optimized to use WARN log printing. This code has not changed since then. It is not a good design to initialize to null when deserialization fails, which delays the time when the error occurs.

Consumers should be aware of deserialization exceptions, not just print logs on the provider.

For previous users, if the deserialization fails, they should deal with the deserialization problem instead of using null parameters, because it seems that the parameters are lost after the Dubbo call.

Reference: [Java Techies Zone: Item 65: Don’t ignore exceptions](http://jtechies.blogspot.com/2012/07/item-65-dont-ignore-exceptions.html)

您好  我看问题关闭了。请问是怎么解决的呢？

Dubbo不是什么的缩写，也不是什么的简称，是澳大利亚的一个“沿海”城市名。

至于为什么是以这个城市来命名呢？据知情人士透露是因为当年的 code name 基本上都是沿着海岸线找的。其他系统也是按照这个规则，选这个也是按照名字顺序或者心情找的。（我还特意看了下聊天记录

所以，故事就是这样。

PS：Dubbo是个美丽而幽静的城市，有空可以去体验一下^-^

报的是序列化异常，因为Function跟BiConsumer没有实现序列化导致的，但这个接口默认方法应该是在消费端执行的，应该不需要序列化才对

给你的 common 模块中的 pom 文件添加如下配置：
```xml
  <build>
      <plugins>
          <plugin>
              <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
              <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
              <configuration>
                  <classifier>exec</classifier>
              </configuration>
          </plugin>
      </plugins>
  </build>
```

不过并不建议这样用，包含 SpringBoot 的模块不要作为二方包给其他模块用，建议这个模块剔除 SpringBoot

- 博客：https://blog.csdn.net/guduyishuai/article/details/60968728
- 官方文档：https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/2.6.2/maven-plugin/reference/htmlsingle/#packaging.examples.custom-classifier

```xml
<dependency>

                <artifactId>dubbo-bom</artifactId>
                <version>${dubbo.version}</version>
                <type>pom</type>
                <scope>import</scope>
            </dependency>

            <dependency>
                <groupId>org.apache.dubbo</groupId>
                <artifactId>dubbo-dependencies-zookeeper</artifactId>
                <version>${dubbo.version}</version>
                <type>pom</type>
            </dependency>
```

> 
> ```java
> 2022-01-06 00:42:36.564  WARN 22628 o.a.d.r.zookeeper.ZookeeperRegistry      :  [DUBBO] Failed to save registry cache file, will retry, cause: null, dubbo version: 3.0.5, current host: 10.18.0.3
> 
> java.nio.channels.OverlappingFileLockException: null
> 	at sun.nio.ch.SharedFileLockTable.checkList(FileLockTable.java:255)
> 	at sun.nio.ch.SharedFileLockTable.add(FileLockTable.java:152)
> 	at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.tryLock(FileChannelImpl.java:1107)
> 	at java.nio.channels.FileChannel.tryLock(FileChannel.java:1155)
> 	at org.apache.dubbo.registry.support.AbstractRegistry.doSaveProperties(AbstractRegistry.java:187)
> 	at org.apache.dubbo.registry.support.AbstractRegistry$SaveProperties.run(AbstractRegistry.java:555)
> 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
> 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
> 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
> ```
> 
> I didn’t look into the code in depth it looks like it’s caused by repeated locks, and I found that the latest master branch [code](https://github.com/apache/dubbo/blob/4cc3b28a3e7e76ce18bb0a6d0fd288ab07dae99a/dubbo-registry/dubbo-registry-api/src/main/java/org/apache/dubbo/registry/support/AbstractRegistry.java#L182) has been fixed. I also saw the same logic in `AbstractMetadataReport`, so I thought it might be a potential problem, so I submitted pr
> 
> see also this(#9358)

You can look at the `FileCacheStore` of the latest 3.0 code. This file lock will not be released every time it is used up, but will be released when the `FileCacheStore#destroy` method is finally called. You can also refer to the handling of `OverlappingFileLockException` in `FileCacheStore` .

In addition, this exception occurs when two application cache files opened on a machine have the same name, which leads to tryLock on the same file, which triggers this exception. For example, the following two test cases will trigger
